arm_group.description: those subjects having an elective cesarean section will complete an informed consent form, complete the preoperative questionnaire, and then be contacted for 60 days postoperatively

brief_summary.textblock:
Many factors influence the development of persistent pain after CS (chronic pain) as well as
      post-partum depression. We are attempting to use trajectory pain methods in an attempt to
      identify those at risk for the development of persistent pain post delivery using a daily
      method of contact for the determination of pain scores.

detailed_description.textblock:
Subjects are contacted on a daily basis after having a cesarean delivery to determine
      current pain, current pain unpleasantness, worst pain, worst pain unpleasantness, average
      pain, and average pain unpleaseantness.  Preoperatively subjects complete a
      psycho-social/depressive screening questionnaire. Pain treatments are captured for the first
      24 hours.  Mother/baby outcomes are also captured.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:

          -  >/= 18 years of age English speaking

        Exclusion Criteria:

          -  history of chronic pain (non-pregnancy related) non-English speaking

study_pop.textblock:
those subjects who are scheduled to have an elective cesarean section (CS) and able to
        complete a preoperative psychosocial/depressive questionnaire and who agree to be
        contacted on a daily basis for 60 days postoperatively

clinical_study.official_title: Novel Approach Using Pre-surgery Psychosocial State and Pain Trajectory Methods to Identify Patient Characteristics and Predict Patients at Risk for Persitent Pain After Cesarean Delivery

oversight_info.authority: United States: Food and Drug Administration

primary_outcome.description: By identifying preoperative risk factors for chronic pain and mapping out the trajectory of pain after cesarean delivery, we may be able to use novel pharmacologic or psychological interventions to alter postoperative pain trajectories.

required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on June 04, 2014
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.
